driver = <selenium.webdriver.chrome.webdriver.WebDriver (session="55ccb94fe84d2db98501074b92f68e56")>

    @allure.title("Playground Scenario Test")
    def test_playground_scenario(driver):
        # Open "The Internet" testing playground
        driver.get("https://the-internet.herokuapp.com/")
    
        # Step 1: Click on the 'A/B Testing' link
        with allure.step("Step 1: Click on the 'A/B Testing' link"):
            driver.find_element(By.LINK_TEXT, "A/B Testing").click()
    
        # Step 2: Verify landing page (buggy)
        with allure.step("Step 2: Verify page title"):
            assert "The Internet" == driver.title  # This should fail due to a bug
    
        # Step 3: Navigate back to the home page
        with allure.step("Step 3: Navigate back to the home page"):
            driver.back()
    
        # Step 4: Click on the 'Add/Remove Elements' link
        with allure.step("Step 4: Click on the 'Add/Remove Elements' link"):
            driver.find_element(By.LINK_TEXT, "Add/Remove Elements").click()
    
        # Step 5: Click 'Add Element' button
        with allure.step("Step 5: Click 'Add Element' button"):
            driver.find_element(By.CSS_SELECTOR, "button[onclick='addElement()']").click()
    
        # Step 6: Verify element added
        with allure.step("Step 6: Verify element added"):
            assert len(driver.find_elements(By.CLASS_NAME, "added-manually")) == 1  # This should fail due to a bug
    
        # Step 7: Click 'Delete' button
        with allure.step("Step 7: Click 'Delete' button"):
            delete_button = driver.find_element(By.CLASS_NAME, "added-manually")
            delete_button.find_element(By.XPATH, "..").find_element(By.XPATH, "./button[text()='Delete']").click()
    
        # Step 8: Verify element deleted
        with allure.step("Step 8: Verify element deleted"):
